author: Sky Sports Tennis
title: WATCH: Denis Shapovalov hits umpire Arnaud Gabas with ball in Davis Cup | Tennis News | Sky Sports
text:
WATCH: Denis Shapovalov hits umpire Arnaud Gabas with ball in Davis Cup Wimbledon junior champion Denis Shapovalov 'incredibly ashamed and embarrassed' By Sky Sports Tennis Last Updated: 06/02/17 12:44pm Denis Shapovalov of Canada accidentally hit umpire Arnaud Gabas with a ball Teenager Denis Shapovalov defaulted a Davis Cup tie against Great Britain when a ball he smacked in frustration hit umpire Arnaud Gabas in the eye. 
Already two sets up, Briton Kyle Edmund broke for 2-1 lead in set three and, on losing the point, Shapovalov thumped a ball away in frustration. 
The ball smashed straight into umpire Gabas, whose left eye was badly swollen and had to be iced after the impact. 
Shapovalov, 17, was distraught after the incident and apologised profusely while Gabas was given ice, while TV pictures showed his left eye badly swollen. Shapovalov was stunned after accidentally hitting Gabas in the eye 
An emotional Shapovalov, who was playing in only his second Davis Cup tie, said: "I feel incredibly ashamed and embarrassed and I just feel awful for letting my team down, for letting my country down, for acting in a way that Iwould never want to act. 
"I can promise that's the last time I will do anything like that. I'm going to learn from this and try to move past it." 
Britain moved through to a quarter-final meeting with France in April. 
Click the video above to watch how this Davis Cup tie ended in the most bizarre of fashions... Also See:
